get.summary: Agents return the agents that pushed data to the server

post.summary:
Write accepts profiling data encoded as an arrow record. It's a
bi-directional streaming RPC, because the first message can contain only
samples without the stacktraces, and only reference stacktrace IDs. The
backend can then request the full stacktrace from the client should it not
know the stacktrace yet.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
WriteRequest may contain an apache arrow record that only contains profiling
samples with a reference to a stacktrace ID, or a full stacktrace. If it
only contains samples, the server may request the full stacktrace from the
client should it not already know them. (streaming inputs)

post.summary: WriteArrow accepts an arrow IPC buffer containing profiling data.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: WriteArrowRequest is the request containing an arrow IPC buffer.

post.summary: WriteRaw accepts a raw set of bytes of a pprof file

value.title: value is the value for the label name

profilestorev1alpha1Label.title: Label is a key value pair of identifiers

id.description:
id is the agent identity that either represent by the node name or the IP address.
When node name is not found, this will fallback to IP address.

lastError.title: last_error is the error message most recently received from a push attempt

lastPush.title: last_push is the time stamp the last push request was performed

lastPushDuration.title: last_push_duration is the duration of the last push request

agents.title: agents is a list of agents

v1alpha1AgentsResponse.title: AgentsResponse is the request to retrieve a list of agents

elfType.description:
elf_type is the type of the elf executable. Technically the elf type is a
16 bit integer, but protobuf's smallest unsigned integer is 32 bits.

loadSegment.description: load_segment is the load segment of the executable.

v1alpha1ExecutableInfo.description:
ExecutableInfo is the information about the executable and executable
section for normalizaton purposes before symbolization.

labels.title: labels are the grouping of labels

v1alpha1LabelSet.title: LabelSet is a group of labels

offset.description: The offset from the beginning of the file at which the first byte of the segment resides.

vaddr.description: The virtual address at which the first byte of the segment resides in memory.

v1alpha1LoadSegment.title: LoadSegment is the load segment of the executable

labels.title: LabelSet is the key value pairs to identify the corresponding profile

samples.title: samples are the set of profile bytes

v1alpha1RawProfileSeries.title: RawProfileSeries represents the pprof profile and its associated labels

rawProfile.title: raw_profile is the set of bytes of the pprof profile

executableInfo.description:
information about the executable and executable section for normalizaton
purposes.

v1alpha1RawSample.title: RawSample is the set of bytes that correspond to a pprof profile

ipcBuffer.description: ipc_buffer is the raw bytes of an arrow IPC file.

v1alpha1WriteArrowRequest.description: WriteArrowRequest is the request containing an arrow IPC buffer.

v1alpha1WriteArrowResponse.description: WriteArrowResponse is the response for the WriteArrow RPC.

tenant.title: tenant is the given tenant to store the pprof profile under

series.title: series is a set raw pprof profiles and accompanying labels

normalized.title: normalized is a flag indicating if the addresses in the profile is normalized for position independent code

v1alpha1WriteRawRequest.title: WriteRawRequest writes a pprof profile for a given tenant

record.description: The bytes containing the arrow record.

v1alpha1WriteRequest.description:
WriteRequest may contain an apache arrow record that only contains profiling
samples with a reference to a stacktrace ID, or a full stacktrace. If it
only contains samples, the server may request the full stacktrace from the
client should it not already know them.

record.description:
When record is non-empty it contains the bytes of an arrow record that
contains a column containing the stacktraces that are unknown.

v1alpha1WriteResponse.description:
WriteResponse may be empty if the server doesn't need any further
information, or contain an arrow record that contains the stacktrace IDs
that are unknown and therefore requested by the client from the server.
